complaint_summary: The department objected to the exclusion of income covered under Section 80B from the total income as defined in Section 2(24) of the Income-tax Ordinance, 1979.
investigation_summary: The assessing officer rejected the assessee's claim for minimum tax liability relief under Part III of the Second Schedule to the Income-tax Ordinance, 1979, citing inclusion of income under Section 80B and exempt income.
judgment_summary: The Appellate Tribunal Inland Revenue upheld the decision of the learned C.I.T.(A), Sukkur, agreeing that income covered under Section 80B should be excluded from total income for tax relief computation under Part III of the Second Schedule to the Income-tax Ordinance, 1979.
legal_arguments: Income covered under Section 80B falls within the presumptive tax regime and overrides general provisions of the Income-tax Ordinance, 1979.
Presumptive tax regime income is not included in total income as defined under Section 2(24) of the Income-tax Ordinance.
Tax relief computation under Part III of the Second Schedule excludes income subject to fixed tax rates.
key_issues: Exclusion of income under Section 80B for tax relief computation.
Applicability of presumptive tax regime provisions.

legal_terms.Presumptive Tax Regime: A tax system where income is taxed at fixed rates without computation of total income.
legal_terms.Total Income: Income defined under Section 2(24) of the Income-tax Ordinance.

words_and_phrases.Non-obstante Clause: A clause that overrides conflicting provisions in other laws.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the exclusion of income under Section 80B from total income for tax relief computation under Part III of the Second Schedule to the Income-tax Ordinance, 1979. The Appellate Tribunal Inland Revenue upheld the decision of the learned C.I.T.(A), Sukkur, dismissing the department's appeal and confirming that presumptive tax regime income is not included in total income.
